quizzes.questionText: What should a person do if they break their fast due to extreme thirst?

options.text: Drink only enough to ward off harm, then abstain until sunset
Continue eating and drinking freely for the rest of the day
Not make up the fast since it was broken due to necessity
Break the fast completely and resume fasting the next day

quizzes.explanation: When someone breaks their fast due to extreme thirst and fear of harm, they should drink only enough to remove the danger, then must abstain from eating and drinking until sunset. They must also make up that day's fast later.

quizzes.questionText: Is it necessary to add another name before 'Fatimah' when naming a girl?

options.text: No, you can simply name her Fatimah without any additions
Yes, you must add Ghulam, Kaneez, or Noor before Fatimah
Yes, it is obligatory to add at least one other name
It depends on the family tradition and culture

quizzes.explanation: You can name your daughter Fatimah without adding any other name to it. When referring to Fatimah the daughter of the Prophet (peace be upon him), we add 'radiya Allahu anha' (may Allah be pleased with her) as she was one of the Companions.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a civil engineer to draw architectural plans for buildings financed with riba-based loans?

options.text: Yes, if the building itself is for permissible purposes like residential homes
No, any involvement with riba-financed projects is forbidden
Only if you donate a portion of your earnings to charity
Yes, but only for commercial buildings, not residential ones

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible to draw plans for permissible buildings like homes, even if the owner finances them with riba-based loans. The engineer is not helping in the sin of riba itself but doing permissible work. However, it would be forbidden to design buildings for evil purposes like riba-based banks or bars.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use tricks to avoid paying excessive electricity bills charged by the state?

options.text: No, it is considered cheating and consuming people's wealth unlawfully
Yes, if the state is charging unjust prices
Yes, but only in non-Muslim countries
Yes, as long as you donate the saved money to charity

quizzes.explanation: Even if the state charges excessive prices, it is not permissible to tamper with meters or use tricks to avoid paying bills. This constitutes cheating, deception, and consuming people's wealth unlawfully. Muslims should be patient and seek reward with Allah rather than respond to injustice in kind.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on praying in a garment that has images of animate beings on it?

options.text: The prayer is valid but it is disliked and should be avoided
The prayer is completely invalid and must be repeated
It is permissible without any dislike
Only images of humans invalidate the prayer

quizzes.explanation: The prayer remains valid if performed in clothes with images, but it is disliked (makruh). Images of animate beings are prohibited in Islam and may distract from prayer. It is better to avoid such clothing for prayer.

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on men wearing gold jewelry?

options.text: It is completely forbidden for men to wear gold
It is permissible if the gold is less than 5 grams
It is permissible for wedding rings only
It is disliked but not explicitly forbidden

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) explicitly forbade gold for men in any amount or form. This includes rings, necklaces, watches, or any gold items. Silver is permissible for men within reasonable limits.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to shake hands with members of the opposite gender who are not mahram?

options.text: No, it is forbidden to shake hands with non-mahram
Yes, if done in professional settings
Yes, if there is no desire involved
It is only permissible for elderly people

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) said he never touched the hand of a woman who was not permissible for him. It is forbidden for men and women who are not mahram to shake hands or touch, regardless of the situation or intent.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on celebrating birthdays in Islam?

options.text: It is an innovation (bidah) not prescribed in Islam
It is permissible as a cultural celebration
It is recommended to show gratitude to Allah
It is permissible for children under 12

quizzes.explanation: Celebrating birthdays is considered an innovation as it was not practiced by the Prophet (peace be upon him) or his Companions. Muslims have two prescribed celebrations: Eid al-Fitr and Eid al-Adha. Adding celebrations imitates non-Muslim practices.

quizzes.questionText: Is it obligatory for men to attend congregational prayer at the mosque?

options.text: Yes, according to the strongest scholarly opinion
No, it is highly recommended but optional
It is only obligatory for Friday prayer
It depends on the distance from the mosque

quizzes.explanation: The strongest scholarly opinion is that congregational prayer at the mosque is obligatory for men who are able. The Prophet (peace be upon him) strongly emphasized this and considered avoiding it despite hearing the adhan a sign of hypocrisy.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman traveling without a mahram?

options.text: It is not permissible except in cases of dire necessity
It is permissible with a group of trustworthy women
It is permissible for short distances under 80 km
Modern transportation makes it permissible

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) forbade women from traveling without a mahram. This ruling remains valid regardless of transportation or perceived safety. A mahram provides protection and proper guardianship.

quizzes.questionText: Can Zakat be given to one's own parents or children?

options.text: No, Zakat cannot be given to ascendants or descendants
Yes, family members have the most right to Zakat
Yes, but only in extreme poverty
It's permissible for parents but not children

quizzes.explanation: Zakat cannot be given to parents, grandparents, children, or grandchildren because one is already obligated to support them financially. Supporting them is an obligation, not charity. Zakat can be given to other relatives like siblings and cousins.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on listening to music with musical instruments?

options.text: It is forbidden according to the majority of scholars
It is permissible if the lyrics are clean
Only certain instruments are forbidden
It is permissible during weddings

quizzes.explanation: The majority of scholars consider musical instruments forbidden based on various hadiths. The only exception is the daff (hand drum) for women during weddings and Eid. This applies regardless of lyrics or occasion.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to celebrate Christmas or other non-Islamic festivals?

options.text: No, Muslims should not participate in non-Islamic festivals
Yes, if done culturally without religious meaning
Yes, to show respect and coexistence
It's permissible to attend but not organize

quizzes.explanation: Muslims should not celebrate or participate in non-Islamic religious festivals as this imitates other religions and weakens Islamic identity. Muslims have two Eids designated by Allah.

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum amount of gold that makes Zakat obligatory?

options.text: Approximately 85 grams of gold
40 grams of gold
200 grams of gold
100 grams of gold

quizzes.explanation: The nisab for gold is approximately 85 grams (20 dinars). If someone owns this amount or more for one lunar year, they must pay 2.5% as Zakat. This applies to gold kept for investment.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to pray voluntary prayers during the forbidden times?

options.text: No, except prayers with a specific reason
Yes, all prayers are permitted at all times
No voluntary prayers allowed without exception
Only two-unit prayers are forbidden

quizzes.explanation: During forbidden times (after Fajr until sunrise, at zenith, after Asr until sunset), voluntary prayers without specific reason are prohibited. However, prayers with a reason like tahiyyat al-masjid may be prayed.

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on male circumcision?

options.text: It is obligatory or highly emphasized by scholarly consensus
It is merely a recommended Sunnah
It is only required before marriage
It is a cultural practice without religious basis

quizzes.explanation: Circumcision for males is either obligatory or highly emphasized according to scholarly consensus. It is part of the fitrah (natural disposition) and has religious and health benefits.

quizzes.questionText: Should missed Ramadan fasts be made up before the next Ramadan?

options.text: Yes, delaying without excuse is disliked
You can delay indefinitely without consequence
It must be made up within one month
You must pay fidyah instead if delayed

quizzes.explanation: Missed fasts should be made up before the next Ramadan. Delaying without valid excuse is disliked. If delayed until next Ramadan, one must make up the fasts and may need to feed a poor person for each day.

quizzes.questionText: Is it forbidden for men to wear gold in any circumstance?

options.text: Yes, it is completely forbidden in any amount
Small amounts under 5 grams are permissible
Wedding rings are an exception
It is disliked but not explicitly haram

quizzes.explanation: It is completely forbidden for men to wear gold in any amount. The Prophet (peace be upon him) explicitly forbade gold and silk for men. This includes all gold items - rings, necklaces, watches, etc.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on using Allah's name carelessly in everyday speech?

options.text: Allah's name should be used with respect, not in vain
It's permissible as long as not cursing
It's only forbidden during prayer times
Arabic usage is fine, other languages are not

quizzes.explanation: Allah's name must be mentioned with respect and reverence, not used carelessly or in vain. Swearing by Allah casually or using His name without proper respect is prohibited.

quizzes.questionText: Is saying 'Bismillah' before eating obligatory?

options.text: It is obligatory or highly recommended according to scholars
It is a cultural tradition without religious basis
Only obligatory for shared meals
Saying it silently is forbidden

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) commanded saying 'Bismillah' before eating. Scholars differ on whether it's obligatory or highly recommended, but all agree it should not be neglected.

quizzes.questionText: What is the nisab (minimum threshold) for silver that makes Zakat obligatory?

options.text: Approximately 595 grams of silver
85 grams of silver
200 grams of silver
1000 grams of silver

quizzes.explanation: The nisab for silver is 200 dirhams, approximately 595 grams. If owned for one lunar year, 2.5% must be paid as Zakat. Many scholars recommend using silver nisab for currency calculations.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on a woman removing her hijab in front of her brother-in-law?

options.text: It is forbidden; she must maintain hijab
It's permissible as he is family
It's permissible if her husband is present
It's permissible after years of family relationship

quizzes.explanation: A brother-in-law is not a mahram. The Prophet (peace be upon him) warned that 'the in-law is death,' meaning the danger of mixing. She cannot remove hijab or be alone with him.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to perform Hajj using borrowed money?

options.text: Yes, but Hajj only becomes obligatory when affordable without borrowing
No, Hajj with debt is invalid
Yes, and it's recommended to borrow for Hajj
It depends on interest-free vs interest loans

quizzes.explanation: Performing Hajj with borrowed money is valid, but Hajj is only obligatory on those with financial means. If unable to afford without borrowing, it's not yet obligatory. Ability to repay is also a consideration.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to work as a cashier in a store selling both halal and haram items?

options.text: No, it involves helping in selling haram items
Yes, if most items are halal
Yes, if you refuse to scan haram items
Yes, as long as you don't consume them

quizzes.explanation: Working as a cashier where haram items like alcohol or pork are sold is impermissible. The cashier directly participates in the sale, constituting helping in sin. Muslims should seek halal employment.

quizzes.questionText: At what age does fasting become obligatory for children?

options.text: When they reach puberty, though training should begin earlier
Seven years old like prayer
Ten years old for all children
Twelve years as a fixed age

quizzes.explanation: Fasting becomes obligatory at puberty. However, parents should train children before this when able, to prepare them. The exact age varies by individual development.

quizzes.questionText: What should someone do if they miss Fajr prayer due to oversleeping?

options.text: Pray it immediately upon waking as qada (makeup)
Wait until next Fajr and pray double
Pray extra voluntary prayers to compensate
The prayer is lost and cannot be made up

quizzes.explanation: If someone misses Fajr due to oversleeping, they should pray it as soon as they wake. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said whoever forgets or sleeps through a prayer should pray it when they remember.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for women to pluck or shape their eyebrows?

options.text: No, plucking eyebrows is forbidden based on the Prophet's curse
Yes, if done moderately
Yes, for married women with husband's permission
Trimming is permissible, plucking is not

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet (peace be upon him) cursed those who pluck eyebrows. This includes trimming, shaping, or removing eyebrow hair. Muslim women should avoid this regardless of beauty trends.

quizzes.questionText: Can prayers be combined (jam') when staying in one place (not traveling)?

options.text: Generally only permitted when traveling
Permitted for any valid excuse including work
Permitted on Fridays for Jumu'ah attendees
Permitted if fearing to miss prayer time

quizzes.explanation: Combining prayers is generally only permitted when traveling. For residents, each prayer should be in its time. Some scholars permit combining for severe hardship, but this isn't the general rule.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use products with animal-derived ingredients of unknown source?

options.text: The basic principle is permissibility unless proven haram
All animal ingredients should be avoided
Only certified halal products can be used
Forbidden unless you verify each ingredient

quizzes.explanation: The basic principle is permissibility. If the source is unknown, it's permissible unless proven to be from prohibited sources. Muslims aren't required to investigate every ingredient.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to work in a restaurant that serves haram food like pork or alcohol?

options.text: No, it involves assisting in serving haram
Yes, if you only handle halal items
Yes, if haram is less than 50% of sales
Yes, in non-Muslim countries due to necessity

quizzes.explanation: Working where haram food is served is impermissible, even handling only halal items. The worker participates in the operation serving haram, constituting helping in sin. Seek halal employment.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on women wearing pants outside the home?

options.text: Not permissible as it doesn't fulfill Islamic dress conditions
Permissible if loose and covered by long shirt
Permissible for exercise only
Permissible in modern times

quizzes.explanation: Women wearing pants outside is problematic as it imitates men's clothing and typically doesn't meet hijab requirements. Islamic dress should be loose, cover the body, and not resemble men's clothing.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use credit cards that potentially charge interest?

options.text: Permissible if paid in full monthly; impermissible if paying interest
Completely forbidden in all circumstances
Permissible as interest goes to banks not individuals
Permissible only in non-Muslim countries

quizzes.explanation: Credit cards are permissible if the balance is paid before interest accrues. If there's risk of paying interest, avoid them. Interest (riba) is a major sin regardless of amount or recipient.

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum number of people required for valid congregational prayer?

options.text: Two people: an imam and one follower
At least three people
Minimum four people
Seven people for congregation reward

quizzes.explanation: Congregational prayer can be established with two people: one as imam and one following. The Prophet (peace be upon him) prayed with Companions in groups of two. Reward multiplies with more participants.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for Muslims to celebrate Valentine's Day?

options.text: No, it imitates a non-Islamic celebration with pagan origins
Yes, as a cultural day to express love
Yes, for married couples only
Permissible without religious elements

quizzes.explanation: Valentine's Day is impermissible as it imitates non-Islamic celebrations with pagan and Christian origins. Muslims shouldn't participate even 'culturally.' Express love to spouses year-round per Islamic teachings.

quizzes.questionText: Is wudu valid if performed with nail polish on?

options.text: No, water must touch the nails for valid wudu
Yes, if using water-permeable polish
Yes, but it's disliked
Only gel polish is problematic

quizzes.explanation: Wudu requires water to touch all parts including nails. Regular nail polish creates a barrier preventing this, invalidating wudu. Women must remove nail polish before wudu or ghusl for valid prayers.

quizzes.questionText: Can adopted children be given the adoptive family's surname in Islam?

options.text: No, child must keep biological father's name
Yes, full adoption with name change is permissible
Adoption is completely forbidden
Name change allowed if father unknown

quizzes.explanation: While caring for orphans is encouraged, the child must keep their biological father's name. Calling them by other than their father's name is forbidden. Fostering and caring is permissible and rewarded.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on saying 'Jumu'ah Mubarak' or similar Friday greetings?

options.text: It is an innovation not done by Prophet or Companions
It is recommended to congratulate on Friday
It is obligatory to greet Muslims on Jumu'ah
Permissible as cultural custom

quizzes.explanation: Specifying Friday greetings is an innovation not practiced by the Prophet or Companions. Making it regular practice adds to religion. The general greeting 'As-salamu alaykum' can be used any day.

quizzes.questionText: Is prayer valid behind an imam who shaves his beard?

options.text: Yes, prayer is valid though shaving beard is sinful
No, prayer behind such imam is invalid
Only if no other mosque available
Valid but must repeat prayer later

quizzes.explanation: Prayer behind an imam who shaves his beard is valid, though shaving is sinful. We don't invalidate prayers due to sins. If better imam available, it's preferable. Beard is obligatory per strongest opinion.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on women wearing high heels that make noise?

options.text: Not permissible if it attracts attention or makes clicking sounds
Completely permissible for all occasions
Only permissible inside the home
Permissible if worn with abaya

quizzes.explanation: Women shouldn't wear shoes that make noise or attract attention, going against modesty principles. Allah says women shouldn't strike feet to make known hidden adornment. Inside home for husband is different.

quizzes.questionText: Is the Witr prayer obligatory?

options.text: It is confirmed Sunnah, not obligatory per majority
It is obligatory like five daily prayers
Only obligatory during Ramadan
Merely recommended with no emphasis

quizzes.explanation: Witr is a confirmed Sunnah that shouldn't be neglected, though not obligatory per majority. The Prophet never abandoned it whether traveling or resident. Prayed after Isha until before Fajr.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for women to attend mosque for prayers?

options.text: Permissible but praying at home is better for them
Obligatory like for men
Completely forbidden except Taraweeh
Only permissible for elderly women

quizzes.explanation: Women can go to mosque with proper hijab and husband's permission, but home prayer is better. The Prophet said best rows for women are the last. Women shouldn't wear perfume or adornments when going out.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to keep a dog as a pet in the house?

options.text: Not permissible except for hunting, guarding, or farming
Permissible if kept outdoors only
Permissible in modern times for companionship
Small dogs permissible, large dogs not

quizzes.explanation: Dogs only permissible for hunting, guarding livestock/crops, or farming. The Prophet said angels don't enter houses with dogs, and reward is deducted daily from those keeping dogs without valid reason.

quizzes.questionText: What is Islam's ruling on tattoos?

options.text: Forbidden; Prophet cursed those who get tattoos
Permissible for medical purposes only
Disliked but not forbidden
Only permanent ones forbidden, temporary allowed

quizzes.explanation: Tattoos are forbidden. The Prophet cursed those who do and receive tattoos. They involve changing Allah's creation and causing pain without valid reason. Those with pre-Islamic tattoos should repent but needn't remove if harmful.

quizzes.questionText: Is taking pictures and photographs permissible in Islam?

options.text: Permissible for necessity, but image-making is discouraged
All photography is completely forbidden
Only video forbidden, still images fine
Permissible without restrictions in modern times

quizzes.explanation: Photography is permissible for necessity like ID cards, but general image-making is discouraged as images of animate beings are problematic. Displaying at home, especially where prayer is performed, is more discouraged. Scholarly difference exists.

quizzes.questionText: What is the minimum distance defining travel (safar) for prayer concessions?

options.text: Approximately 80 km (50 miles) per most scholars
Any journey outside your city
More than 200 km (125 miles)
Whatever people customarily consider travel

quizzes.explanation: Strongest opinion is travel begins at approximately 80 km or 48 miles. At this distance, travelers may shorten and combine prayers. Some say what's customarily considered travel, others specify different distances.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for women to wear makeup outside the home?

options.text: No, makeup should only be for one's husband
Yes, if light and natural-looking
Yes, except in the mosque
Permissible for special occasions only

quizzes.explanation: Women shouldn't wear makeup outside as it attracts attention and is adornment that should be concealed. Allah commands women not to display adornment except to mahrams. Makeup is for husband in privacy.

quizzes.questionText: Is listening to Quran recitation beneficial without understanding the meaning?

options.text: Yes, beneficial and rewarded, but understanding adds greater benefit
Pointless without understanding
Only beneficial if learning Arabic simultaneously
Understanding required for reward

quizzes.explanation: Listening to Quran is beneficial even without understanding, as the Quran itself is blessed. However, Muslims should strive to understand meanings for greater benefit and implementation. Reading translation is highly recommended.

quizzes.questionText: Is using Instagram and social media permissible?

options.text: Permissible if used for good and avoiding haram content
All social media forbidden due to mixing and fitna
Permissible only for dawah
Permissible for men but not women

quizzes.explanation: Social media are tools usable for good or evil. Permissible for beneficial purposes like learning, dawah, and connection, while avoiding haram content, free mixing, and displaying awrah. Maintain Islamic etiquette and guard against fitna.

quizzes.questionText: Is it forbidden to fast only on Fridays for voluntary fasting?

options.text: Yes, forbidden to single out Friday for fasting
No, recommended to fast Fridays
Permissible without restrictions
Only forbidden if missing Jumu'ah

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet forbade singling out Friday for fasting. However, permissible if fasting Thursday before or Saturday after, or if it coincides with regular fasting pattern like alternate days.

quizzes.questionText: Is reciting Surah Al-Fatihah in every unit of prayer obligatory?

options.text: Yes, it is a pillar per strongest opinion
Only obligatory in first two units
Recommended but not obligatory
Only obligatory for imam, not followers

quizzes.explanation: Per strongest opinion, reciting Fatihah in every unit is obligatory for imam and individual. The Prophet said: 'No prayer for one who doesn't recite the Opening of the Book.' Scholarly difference exists for followers.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on plastic surgery for beautification purposes?

options.text: Forbidden as it changes Allah's creation without necessity
Permissible if done moderately
Permissible for women before marriage
All surgery including corrective is forbidden

quizzes.explanation: Cosmetic surgery for mere beautification is forbidden as it changes Allah's creation. However, surgery correcting deformities, repairing injuries, or removing genuine abnormalities causing significant harm is permissible. Key is necessity vs beautification.

quizzes.questionText: Is eating food sacrificed at non-Muslim festivals permissible?

options.text: Not permissible as it involves participating in their festivals
Permissible if the food itself is halal
Permissible from People of the Book
Permissible if not attending festival yourself

quizzes.explanation: Food specifically sacrificed for non-Islamic festivals shouldn't be eaten, as consuming implies approval and participation. Different from general permissible food by People of the Book. Avoid anything suggesting celebrating non-Islamic religious occasions.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on saying 'RIP' (Rest in Peace) when someone dies?

options.text: Should be avoided; use Islamic supplications instead
Permissible as it's just cultural
Permissible if deceased was Muslim
Recommended as it shows compassion

quizzes.explanation: Muslims should use Islamic phrases like 'Inna lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji'un' and make dua if Muslim. 'RIP' is from other faiths and not Islamic tradition. Maintain distinct Islamic identity in expressions.

quizzes.questionText: Is prayer valid in a garment contaminated with impurity if unable to remove it?

options.text: Yes, if unable to remove, pray as you are without repeating
No, must delay prayer until finding pure clothing
Yes, but must repeat when finding pure clothing
Should pray naked rather than in impure clothing

quizzes.explanation: If unable to remove impure garment or find pure clothing, pray as you are - prayer is valid per principle 'what is obligatory is only what one is capable of.' No need to repeat. Allah doesn't burden beyond capacity.

quizzes.questionText: Is women working outside the home permissible in Islam?

options.text: Permissible with conditions: hijab, avoiding mixing, no neglect of duties
Completely forbidden in all circumstances
Obligatory for women to contribute financially
Only for widows and divorcees

quizzes.explanation: Women working is permissible if: maintaining hijab, avoiding inappropriate mixing, work itself permissible, husband's permission if married, not neglecting home/children. Financial need makes it more permissible, but not obligatory.

quizzes.questionText: Can dua (supplication) be made in languages other than Arabic?

options.text: Yes, dua can be in any language - Allah understands all
No, all dua must be Arabic to be accepted
Only during prayer must dua be Arabic
Permissible only for non-Arabic speakers

quizzes.explanation: Dua can be in any language as Allah understands all and knows hearts. However, using authentic Arabic supplications from Quran and Sunnah is more virtuous. During formal prayer, prescribed dhikr must be Arabic.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on cutting hair and nails during first ten days of Dhul-Hijjah for those sacrificing?

options.text: Forbidden from start of Dhul-Hijjah until after sacrificing
Disliked but not forbidden
Only forbidden on Eid day itself
Only applies to those performing Hajj

quizzes.explanation: For those intending to sacrifice, it's forbidden to remove hair or cut nails from beginning of Dhul-Hijjah until after sacrifice. The Prophet said when seeing new moon, if wanting to sacrifice, don't remove anything from hair or nails.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to delay Asr prayer until the sun turns yellow?

options.text: Permissible but disliked to delay without excuse
Forbidden to pray once sun turns yellow
Prayer must be repeated if prayed during yellowing
It's the preferred time for Asr

quizzes.explanation: Asr time extends until sunset, but it's disliked to delay until sun yellows without valid excuse. The Prophet called this the hypocrite's prayer time. Chosen time is before color change, but prayer remains valid if delayed.

quizzes.questionText: What is the Islamic ruling on commercial insurance?

options.text: Commercial insurance forbidden; cooperative may be permissible
All insurance completely forbidden
Permissible and recommended for protection
Only health insurance permissible

quizzes.explanation: Commercial insurance is forbidden by majority due to riba, gharar (uncertainty), and gambling elements. Cooperative (takaful) insurance on Islamic principles may be permissible. Obligatory insurance creates necessity situation scholars address differently.

quizzes.questionText: Is attending wedding parties with music and free mixing permissible?

options.text: No, should not attend where major sins are committed
Yes, to maintain family ties
Yes, but leave when music starts
Depends on whose wedding it is

quizzes.explanation: Muslims shouldn't attend gatherings where major sins like music and free mixing occur, even weddings. Attending implies approval and supporting sin. If can attend briefly, give gift, leave before prohibited activities, may be permissible while advising family.

quizzes.questionText: Is it forbidden for menstruating women to enter the mosque?

options.text: Forbidden according to majority of scholars
Permissible if wearing proper hijab
Permissible for educational events only
Permissible if she doesn't pray

quizzes.explanation: Majority hold it's forbidden for menstruating women to enter mosque, based on hadith forbidding those in major impurity. Some permit passing if necessary. All permit staying in designated musalla at home or outdoors for Eid.

quizzes.questionText: Is working night shifts permissible if it affects Fajr prayer?

options.text: Permissible if one ensures praying Fajr on time
Night shift work is forbidden
Permissible and can combine Fajr with Dhuhr
Only permissible in non-Muslim countries

quizzes.explanation: Night shifts permissible if fulfilling prayer obligations on time. If work causes regularly missing Fajr, seek alternative employment or arrangements. Prayer is obligatory and takes precedence over work.

quizzes.questionText: Is reading from the Mushaf (Quran) during prayer permissible?

options.text: Yes, especially in voluntary night prayers
Forbidden in all prayer types
It invalidates the prayer completely
Only for those who haven't memorized Fatihah

quizzes.explanation: Permissible to read from Mushaf during prayer, particularly voluntary prayers like tahajjud and taraweeh. Aishah had servant lead her in prayer reading from Mushaf during Ramadan. Especially useful for longer recitations.

quizzes.questionText: Is accepting gifts from non-Muslims on their religious festivals permissible?

options.text: Better to politely decline to avoid appearing to approve celebration
Completely forbidden and major sin
Permissible and shows good relations
Permissible if donating to charity

quizzes.explanation: Scholarly difference exists, but safer opinion is politely declining gifts specifically for non-Islamic festivals to avoid implying approval. Different from general gifts for birthdays or non-religious occasions. Maintain distinct identity while being kind.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on dyeing grey hair black?

options.text: Forbidden to dye grey hair black
Permissible for both men and women
Permissible only for women
Permissible if mixed with other colors

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet commanded changing grey hair but avoiding black dye. Using other colors like henna (orange-red) or katam (dark brown) is permissible and recommended. Dyeing black is deception and altering appearance in prohibited way.

quizzes.questionText: Is meat from animals stunned before slaughter permissible?

options.text: Not permissible if stunning causes death before slaughter
All stunned meat permissible if Muslim-raised
Stunning makes slaughter more humane and permissible
Stunning method doesn't affect permissibility

quizzes.explanation: If stunning kills the animal before slaughter, meat is not halal. Stunning only permissible if it subdues without killing, and proper Islamic slaughter (cutting throat, draining blood) is performed while alive. Many modern practices stun to death, making meat haram.

quizzes.questionText: Should women lower their voices in dhikr and supplication?

options.text: Yes, women should lower voices to avoid fitnah
Women can raise voices like men in all situations
Obligatory to remain completely silent
Depends on location, not gender

quizzes.questionText: Is working in a bank that deals with interest (riba) permissible?

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on organ donation after death?

Completely forbidden as violates body sanctity
Obligatory on all Muslims
Only permissible to Muslim recipients

quizzes.questionText: Is praying in clothing with brand logos or names permissible?

options.text: Permissible unless logo is haram (cross, image, etc.)

Only permissible if logos covered

quizzes.explanation: Wearing clothing with brand logos generally permissible in prayer unless logo itself is impermissible (cross, prohibited image, profane text). Prayer remains valid though simple, modest clothing is better. Avoiding extravagance and ostentation encouraged.

quizzes.questionText: What is the scholarly ruling on cryptocurrency and Bitcoin?

Completely forbidden without exception

quizzes.questionText: Can Zakat be given to mosques and Islamic centers?

Only permissible in non-Muslim countries

quizzes.questionText: Is celebrating Mother's Day or Father's Day permissible?

options.text: It's an innovation; honoring parents should be year-round

Recommended to show gratitude
Obligatory to give gifts on these days

quizzes.questionText: Is watching movies and TV shows permissible in Islam?

options.text: Not permissible due to music, immodesty, and wasted time

quizzes.questionText: What is the maximum duration a traveler can shorten prayers?

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for women to visit graveyards?

options.text: Not permissible according to stronger opinion
Permissible and recommended like for men
Permissible only for elderly women
Obligatory to visit relatives' graves

quizzes.explanation: Per stronger opinion, women shouldn't visit graves. The Prophet cursed women who frequently visit graves. Some scholars permit if without wailing or excessive emotion, but safer opinion is avoidance. Men encouraged to visit for remembering death.

quizzes.questionText: Is singing without musical instruments (acappella) permissible?

options.text: Permissible if content appropriate and doesn't lead to haram
All singing is forbidden
Only permissible for children
Forbidden even without instruments

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to recite Quran in a room that has a toilet?

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on celebrating the Prophet's birthday (Mawlid)?

Permissible as cultural tradition

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible for a woman to wear nail polish during menstruation?

options.text: Yes, as wudu is not required during menstruation
Forbidden at all times for Muslim women
Only with water-permeable polish
Discouraged but not explicitly forbidden

quizzes.explanation: Since menstruating woman not required to perform wudu or pray during period, wearing nail polish during menstruation is permissible. However, must remove before period ends for proper wudu for prayers.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use hair extensions or wigs?

options.text: Forbidden based on Prophet's curse on those who add hair

Permissible only for medical hair loss

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet cursed women who add hair extensions (wasilah). This applies to both human and synthetic hair for beautification. Exception may exist for genuine medical conditions causing significant harm, but general beautification is forbidden.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on buying lottery tickets or participating in raffles?

quizzes.questionText: Is it obligatory to stand for the national anthem in one's country?

Only obligatory in Muslim countries

quizzes.explanation: Standing for the national anthem is not an Islamic obligation. It may be permissible as a social norm if it doesn't contradict Islamic beliefs or involve shirk. Muslims should evaluate based on content and context. True loyalty is to Allah above all.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on cosmetic teeth whitening procedures?

options.text: Permissible as it's treatment and removing natural discoloration
Forbidden as it changes Allah's creation

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to perform prayer while wearing clothes with English text on them?

quizzes.explanation: Praying in clothes with English or other language text is permissible unless the text is inappropriate, profane, or disrespectful. The prayer remains valid. However, simple, modest clothing without distracting text is preferable for prayer.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on working as a photographer or videographer for weddings?

Completely forbidden due to image-making

Only video is permissible, not still photography

quizzes.explanation: Working as photographer is permissible for Islamic weddings that don't involve prohibited activities. quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to delay paying Zakat after it becomes due?

Permissible to delay for better investment opportunities
Can be delayed until Ramadan for more reward

quizzes.explanation: Zakat must be paid as soon as it becomes due. Delaying without valid excuse is sinful as it's a right of the poor. Exceptions exist for temporary inability to pay or brief delay for finding deserving recipients. Zakat can be paid early but not delayed after due date.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on men wearing silk clothing?

Permissible if less than 50% silk

Only pure silk is forbidden, blends are allowed

quizzes.explanation: Pure silk is forbidden for men as stated by the Prophet (peace be upon him) who prohibited gold and silk for males. Exception exists for medical necessity like skin conditions. Small amounts mixed with other material (less than 50%) may be permissible according to some scholars.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to attend Friday prayer at a mosque that has graves in it?

Permissible without any dislike

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on surrogacy (having another woman carry your child)?

Permissible with proper contract and payment
Permissible only between co-wives

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to pray behind someone who commits major sins?

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on consuming foods with vanilla extract containing alcohol?

Permissible only with synthetic vanilla

quizzes.questionText: Is it obligatory to make up prayers that were abandoned deliberately?

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on Muslims celebrating their wedding anniversary?

Obligatory to honor the marriage contract

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to work in a grocery store that sells both halal and haram items?

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on performing Umrah or Hajj on behalf of someone still living?

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to use gelatine from non-halal sources in food?

quizzes.questionText: What is the virtue of reading Ayat al-Kursi after obligatory prayers?
