It is forbidden (haram)
It is obligatory
It is disliked (makruh)

quizzes.explanation: Firstly: Covering the awrah is a condition of prayer being valid. If a person plays with his awrah uncovered when he is able to cover it, his prayer is not valid.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Does Touching Wife Break Wudu?

options.text: It is recommended (Sunnah)
It is obligatory
It is forbidden
It has no significance

quizzes.explanation: In this issue, the strongest of the statements of the scholars is that touching the wife does not break the wudu, unless there is a discharge of sperm. This is the statement of Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) and it is also from Ali bin Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with him) as well as Hasan, Mujahid, and Qatadah.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: He was told that his wife had revived a previous forbidden relationship so he divorced her?

options.text: It is permissible with certain conditions
It is absolutely forbidden in all cases
It is always permissible without conditions
It is obligatory in all situations

quizzes.explanation: What you have mentioned in the question covers a number of issues: 1  What you have mentioned about your friend divorcing his wife during her pregnancy is valid according to the consensus of the scholars, because of the hadeeth of Ibn Umar in al-Saheehayn, according to which the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) said: Tell him to take her back, then to divorce her when she is pure (not menstruating) or pregnant.  That indicates that whoever divorces (his wife when she is) pregnant, the divorce is valid.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Some companies put the buyer in a pyramid scheme without him wanting that?

options.text: It is permissible with certain conditions
It is absolutely forbidden in all cases
It is always permissible without conditions
It is obligatory in all situations

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible to join pyramid marketing schemes, because they are based on deception, gambling and consuming peoples wealth unlawfully. See the answer to question no.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Ruling on fines for late return of borrowed books?

options.text: It is permissible
It is forbidden (haram)
It is obligatory
It is disliked (makruh)

quizzes.explanation: There is nothing wrong with borrowing books, but they must be returned on time. The one who is late in returning them with no excuse is sinning and it is permissible to impose a fine on him for the delay; this fine is a fee for his making use of the book during the excess period.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Divorce does not take place when one merely thinks about it?

options.text: It is obligatory
It is recommended but not obligatory
It is permissible but not required
It has no ruling in Islam

quizzes.explanation: If you did not utter the divorce and the oath, then you do not have to do anything, because thinking to oneself is forgiven, and divorce does not take place if there is only the intention; similarly, an oath is not binding if it was only an intention, rather it must be spoken or something that takes the place thereof such as writing it. Al-Bukhaari (5269) and Muslim (127) narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allaah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (blessings and peace of Allaah be upon him) said: Allaah has forgiven my ummah for whatever crosses their mind so long as they do not speak of it or act upon it.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Ruling on one who swears about something based on what he thinks is likely to be the case, then it turns out to be otherwise?

options.text: It is permissible
It is forbidden (haram)
It is obligatory
It is disliked (makruh)

quizzes.explanation: One of the following scenarios must be true in the case of the one who swears this oath: -Either he knows that what he is swearing to is true; in this case his oath is true and he does not have to do anything -or he knows that he is lying in his oath; in this case he is sinning and committing a major sin -or he is swearing the oath thinking it most likely that it is false; in this case he is breaking his oath, even if it turns out to be as he swore it was -or he is swearing the oath thinking it most likely that it is true; in this case he does not have to do anything, even if it turns out to be other than what he swore to, because he only swore the oath on the basis of what he thought, thinking that he was telling the truth in his oath -or he swore about something without any knowledge of it; in this case he is sinning, because he swore an oath about something that was unknown to him. So if someone says, for example, that So and so did not do such and such, because he is certain or he thinks it most likely that he did not do it, because of what he knows about his religious commitment or attitude, or about his situation that would prevent him from doing that, then he is swearing on the basis of what he thinks is most likely in his view.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: He loves dawah but he had a disturbing dream?

options.text: It is forbidden (haram)
It is permissible
It is recommended
It is disliked but not forbidden

quizzes.explanation: We ask Allaah to make you steadfast in your efforts to fulfil the duty of calling people to Allaah and in your keenness to spread good. Your love of good and your efforts to spread it indicate that you are a good person, in sha Allah.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: How to Offer Condolences in Islam?

options.text: It is permissible
It is forbidden (haram)
It is obligatory
It is disliked (makruh)

quizzes.explanation: Table Of Contents Significance of offering condolences What to say when offering condolences Place and manner of offering condolences Time for offering condolences Significance of offering condolences Offering condolences means comforting the bereaved, urging them to show patience by reminding them of the reward, and praying for the deceased and the one affected by calamity. This is how the jurists (may Allah have mercy on them) have defined it, including Ibn Muflih in Al-Furu` (2/229).

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: The evil consequences of watching movies?

options.text: It is permissible
It is forbidden (haram)
It is obligatory
It is disliked (makruh)

quizzes.explanation: Watching movies includes looking at things that are haraam, such as seeing awrahs, following immoral actions, or listening to things that are haraam such as music and obscene talk. Undoubtedly it is haraam to watch them in this case.
tags: Rulings on sport, leisure and entertainment

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: He vowed to donate two months salary; is it permissible to give that amount over several months?

options.text: It is obligatory
It is recommended but not obligatory
It is permissible but not required
It has no ruling in Islam

quizzes.explanation: Your vow to donate two months salary is a vow to do a good deed, which must be fulfilled, because the Prophet (blessings and peace of Allah be upon him) said: Whoever vowed to obey Allah [by doing a righteous deed], let him obey Him, and whoever vowed to disobey Him, let him not disobey Him.  Narrated by al-Bukhari (6202).

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: The husband's father and mother have no authority over their sons wife?

options.text: It is obligatory
It is recommended but not obligatory
It is permissible but not required
It has no ruling in Islam

quizzes.explanation: Many shari texts indicate that a womans obedience to her husband takes precedence over her obedience to any other person, even her own parents, so how about people other than them. Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyah said: When a woman gets married, her husband has more authority over her and her parents, and obedience to her husband is more obligatory for her.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Does a rich husband have to sponsor his wifes Hajj?

options.text: There are different rulings depending on the situation
It is completely prohibited
It is always permissible
Islam has no guidance on this matter

quizzes.explanation: The husband is not Islamically obliged to pay for his wifes Hajj, even if he is rich, rather that comes under the heading of kind treatment, and she is not obliged to do Hajj because she cannot afford it. And Allah is the Source of strength.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: He became Muslim and he has kaafir friends?

options.text: There are different rulings depending on the situation
It is completely prohibited
It is always permissible
Islam has no guidance on this matter

quizzes.explanation: We put this question to Shaykh Muhammad ibn Saalih al-Uthaymeen, may Allaah preserve him, who answered as follows: He does not have to (cut off ties with his non-Muslim friends), so long as they are not causing him any harm. But he can withdraw from them gradually.
tags: Alliance and Amity, Disavowal and Enmity

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Ruling on performing Hajj before paying off debts?

options.text: It is permissible
It is forbidden (haram)
It is obligatory
It is disliked (makruh)

quizzes.explanation: One of the conditions of Hajj is that one should be able to do it, which includes being financially able. Whoever owes a debt and is being asked to repay it in the sense that his creditors will not let him go for Hajj until after he has paid off the debt should not go for Hajj, because he is not able to.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Verses that are entirely clear (muhkam) and verses that are not entirely clear (mutashaabih) in the Holy Quraan?

options.text: It is obligatory
It is recommended but not obligatory
It is permissible but not required
It has no ruling in Islam

quizzes.explanation: Firstly: Allaah says (interpretation of the meaning): It is He Who has sent down to you (Muhammad    ) the Book (this Quraan). In it are Verses that are entirely clear, they are the foundations of the Book [and those are the Verses of Al-Ahkaam (commandments), Al-Faraaid (obligatory duties) and Al-Hudood (laws for the punishment of thieves, adulterers)]; and others not entirely clear.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: During tawaaf he became unsure (of how many circuits he had completed), so he proceeded on the basis of what he thought was most likely to be the case. Is his tawaaf valid, or does he have to repeat it?

options.text: It is obligatory
It is recommended but not obligatory
It is permissible but not required
It has no ruling in Islam

quizzes.explanation: Firstly: We have previously explained that what one thinks most likely to be the case may be regarded as certainty with regard to rulings. Please see the answer to question no.
tags: Mistakes made by pilgrims performing Hajj and Umrah

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: A minor whose parents' income is haram?

options.text: It is permissible with certain conditions
It is absolutely forbidden in all cases
It is always permissible without conditions
It is obligatory in all situations

quizzes.explanation: Expenditure is obligatory upon a father to his son/daughter according to the Islamic law and shari'ah, as regards his/her housing, clothing, food, drink and the like. However, the concept is not tied to being a "minor" in the sense of Western laws.
tags: Spending on those under ones responsibility

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: becoming a Muslim?

options.text: It is obligatory
It is recommended but not obligatory
It is permissible but not required
It has no ruling in Islam

quizzes.explanation: Any human being can embrace Islam. You do not need anyones permission.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: He lost consciousness because of an accident  does he have to make up his fasts and prayers?

options.text: It is obligatory
It is recommended but not obligatory
It is permissible but not required
It has no ruling in Islam

quizzes.explanation: If it really happened as you say, that this man had lost consciousness during that period  including the month of Ramadaan  when he was not aware of anything as a result of the accident, then he does not have to make up the fasts and prayers that he missed during the days when he was unconscious. This is according to the more correct of the two scholarly opinions, and is because he was not accountable or required to do those acts of worship during that period.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Sportsmen greeting one another with a bow?

options.text: It is permissible with certain conditions
It is absolutely forbidden in all cases
It is always permissible without conditions
It is obligatory in all situations

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible to bow to anyone when greeting them, whether in the context of sports or otherwise. The Prophet (blessings and peace of Allaah be upon him) forbade that.
tags: Rulings on sport, leisure and entertainment

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Offering Udhiyah on Behalf of the Prophet?

options.text: It is permissible with certain conditions
It is absolutely forbidden in all cases
It is always permissible without conditions
It is obligatory in all situations

quizzes.explanation: Table Of Contents Can we offer Udhiyah on behalf of the Prophet. Degree of the Hadith about offering Udhiyah on behalf of the Prophet Can we offer Udhiyah on behalf of the Prophet.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Loving a man in secret and praying that she will marry him?

options.text: It is permissible
It is forbidden (haram)
It is obligatory
It is disliked (makruh)

quizzes.explanation: If this love is not distracting you from the love of Allah, and will not lead to you doing or saying anything haraam, then there is nothing wrong with this, in sha Allah, or with praying to Allah to make him a part of your future  so long as he is a Muslim who fears Allah.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: He broke wind whilst doing ghusl from janaabah; is his ghusl invalidated?

options.text: There are different rulings depending on the situation
It is completely prohibited
It is always permissible
Islam has no guidance on this matter

quizzes.explanation: Passing wind is one of the things that invalidate wudoo but it is not one of the things that invalidate ghusl. Based on this, if a person touches his private part, urinates or passes wind whilst doing ghusl, he should complete his ghusl, then do wudoo afterwards.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Does Feeling That Something Came Out of the Back Passage Break Wudu?

options.text: It is recommended (Sunnah)
It is obligatory
It is forbidden
It has no significance

quizzes.explanation: If a person relieves himself, cleans himself, and then does Wudu, he is in a state of ritual purity until he is certain that there is something that has invalidated his Wudu. His Wudu does not become invalidated because of mere doubts, even if the doubt is so strong that he thinks it most likely.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Does the grandson inherit from his grandfather?

options.text: It is recommended (Sunnah)
It is obligatory
It is forbidden
It has no significance

quizzes.explanation: What you mentioned about the sons of the deceased son not inheriting from their grandfather is correct, but that is subject to the condition that the deceased grandfather does not have one or more living sons. In that case the grandsons are prevented from inheriting by the presence of the son, namely their paternal uncle.
tags: Inheritance and distribution of the estate

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on: Is it permissible to say Except the Messenger of Allaah?

options.text: It is permissible with certain conditions
It is absolutely forbidden in all cases
It is always permissible without conditions
It is obligatory in all situations

quizzes.explanation: Many people have started to use this phrase in defence of our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him) and they have made it a slogan of their boycott on countries which supported those who impugned our Prophet Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allaah be upon him). There is no doubt about the good intention behind the use of this phrase, but there is a problem with regard to its meaning, which is that it mentions an exception but it does not mention from what the exception is.

quizzes.questionText: What are the conditions for using zakaah money for essential house repairs?

options.text: The repairs must be essential (not cosmetic) and appropriate to the poor person's situation
Any repairs can be funded including luxury renovations
Only roof repairs are allowed, no other types
A completely new house must be built

quizzes.explanation: Zakaah can be used for essential repairs if two conditions are met: repairs must be necessary (like preventing wall collapse), and they should be appropriate without extravagance. Shelter is a basic need zakaah helps protect.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on whistling for women?

options.text: Prohibited or strongly disliked as it imitates men
Completely permissible in all circumstances
Only allowed when alone
Recommended as self-expression

quizzes.explanation: Whistling is strongly disliked or prohibited for women as it imitates men and is inappropriate. Muslim women should avoid this action, especially in gatherings.

quizzes.questionText: What should a person with kidney disease do if a trustworthy Muslim doctor advises not to fast?

options.text: Accept Allah's concession and not fast as prescribed
Fast anyway to show strong faith
Fast only half the day
Ignore medical advice completely

quizzes.explanation: When a trustworthy doctor determines fasting will cause harm, one should accept Allah's concession. The Prophet said Allah loves for His concession to be used.

quizzes.questionText: When is it permissible to tell someone about a cheaper source for a product?

options.text: Unless the seller has already made a sale or agreed on a price
Never, it always deprives someone of income
Always with no restrictions
Only if you're the one selling

quizzes.explanation: It's permissible to share information about cheaper alternatives unless a sale or price has been agreed upon. Undercutting after agreement is prohibited.

quizzes.questionText: Does a fisherman who catches and sells fish immediately pay zakaah on it?

options.text: No, unless stored and a full year passes
Yes, immediately upon each catch
Yes, but only if catching more than 10 fish
Fish are never subject to zakaah

quizzes.explanation: Fresh fish sold immediately isn't subject to zakaah. However, if stored and a year passes, zakaah is due. This ruling is from Shaykh Ibn Baaz.

quizzes.questionText: What conditions must be met to give zakaah to a relative studying in university?

options.text: They must be entitled to zakaah and not someone whose maintenance is obligatory on you
Any relative can receive it regardless of financial status
Only relatives in the same city
Students automatically cannot receive zakaah

quizzes.explanation: Giving zakaah to relatives is better as it's charity and upholding ties. Conditions: relative must be poor/needy, and not someone whose maintenance is obligatory (like parents/children).

quizzes.questionText: According to Ibn Taymiyah, what is the key principle for earning a living?

options.text: Trust in Allah and prioritize the Hereafter over worldly concerns
Choose the highest paying career only
Only work in trade and commerce
Wait for provision without effort

quizzes.explanation: Ibn Taymiyah taught trusting Allah and making the Hereafter the main concern. The Prophet said whoever prioritizes the Hereafter finds worldly provision comes easily.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on dyeing hair with unnatural colors like blue or red?

options.text: Prohibited as it imitates non-Muslims and changes Allah's creation
Completely permissible and encouraged
Only allowed for men
Mandatory for elderly people

quizzes.explanation: Dyeing with unnatural colors is prohibited as it imitates non-Muslims and changes Allah's creation impermissibly. Natural modest colors are permissible.

quizzes.questionText: What is required if a baby dies due to a mother's negligence?

options.text: Diyah (blood money) and expiation must be paid
No responsibility as it was an accident
Only fasting for two months required
Just seeking forgiveness is sufficient

quizzes.explanation: If negligence leads to a child's death, Islamic law requires diyah and kaffaarah (freeing a slave or fasting two months). Negligence has serious legal implications.

quizzes.questionText: When is traveling to non-Muslim lands for education permissible?

options.text: If one can practice religion openly and there's genuine benefit
Completely forbidden under all circumstances
Only for people over 60
Obligatory for all Muslims

quizzes.explanation: It's permissible if one can practice religion openly, has knowledge to protect faith, and there's genuine benefit unavailable elsewhere. Must avoid forbidden practices.

quizzes.questionText: Can a mother reject a marriage proposal solely because there was no prior dating relationship?

options.text: No, rejection should be based on Islamic criteria like character and religious commitment
Yes, prior dating is required for marriage
Parents can reject for any reason without justification
The daughter has no say in the decision

quizzes.explanation: Islamic marriage doesn't require prior dating relationships. Rejection should be based on valid Islamic criteria like character, religiosity, and compatibility, not on cultural preferences that contradict Islamic principles.

quizzes.questionText: What should be done with gifts received on birthdays and innovated festivals?

options.text: They may be kept and used as they are permissible wealth
They must be immediately destroyed
They must be returned to the giver
They should be buried

quizzes.explanation: The gifts themselves are permissible wealth that may be kept and used. While celebrating innovated festivals is not allowed, the gifts received are halal property.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on women removing facial hair?

options.text: Permissible to remove except eyebrows which must not be plucked
All facial hair removal is forbidden
Everything including eyebrows can be removed
Only married women can remove facial hair

quizzes.explanation: Women may remove facial hair like mustache or beard, but plucking eyebrows is specifically forbidden based on hadith. The Prophet cursed those who pluck eyebrows.

quizzes.questionText: What should one do if they forgot a circuit of tawaaf and only remembered after sa'i?

options.text: Complete the missing circuit then repeat sa'i
The tawaaf is automatically invalid and cannot be corrected
Continue without correction
Only repeat the tawaaf without repeating sa'i

quizzes.explanation: If one forgets a circuit of tawaaf and remembers after sa'i, they should complete the missing circuit, then repeat the sa'i as it must follow complete tawaaf.

quizzes.questionText: If a woman repeatedly falls into sin with her fianc, what should she do?

options.text: Hasten the marriage or end the relationship to protect her faith
Continue the engagement unchanged
Blame the fianc entirely
Ignore the situation

quizzes.explanation: If an engagement leads to repeated sin, the couple should either hasten the marriage with proper conditions or end the relationship. Protecting one's faith is paramount.

quizzes.questionText: What does verse 33 of Surah Ar-Rahman refer to?

options.text: The inability of jinn and mankind to escape Allah's dominion
The permission to travel through space
A command to explore the universe
The future conquest of planets

quizzes.explanation: The verse 'If you are able to pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, then pass' demonstrates that creation cannot escape Allah's power and dominion.

quizzes.questionText: Can a person with schizophrenia get married?

options.text: Yes, if the condition is controlled and the spouse is fully informed
No, mental illness completely prevents marriage
Yes, but the spouse must not be informed
Only if the person is cured permanently

quizzes.explanation: Marriage is permissible if the condition is controlled with treatment and the prospective spouse is fully informed about the situation. Honesty and realistic expectations are essential.

quizzes.questionText: If a man dies during his divorced wife's 'iddah, what is her status?

options.text: She must complete the 'iddah of divorce, not 'iddah of widowhood
She must observe 'iddah of widowhood and inherits
She has no 'iddah requirement
She can remarry immediately

quizzes.explanation: If irrevocably divorced then he dies during her 'iddah, she completes the divorce 'iddah, not widow's 'iddah. She doesn't inherit as the divorce severed marital ties.

quizzes.questionText: When may someone in i'tikaaf leave the mosque?

options.text: Only for necessary matters like using the bathroom
Anytime they wish
Never under any circumstances
Only for meals

quizzes.explanation: One in i'tikaaf may only leave for necessary matters that cannot be done in the mosque, such as using the bathroom. Leaving unnecessarily invalidates the i'tikaaf.

quizzes.questionText: Does breathing artificial oxygen break the fast?

options.text: No, it does not break the fast
Yes, it always breaks the fast
Only if taken orally
Only if taken for more than one hour

quizzes.explanation: Artificial oxygen does not break the fast as it is not food, drink, or similar. It is treatment that doesn't reach the stomach through normal eating/drinking routes.

quizzes.questionText: Can a nurse pray while wearing scrubs that may have impurities?

options.text: Yes, if unable to remove them and she does her best to clean them
No, prayer is completely invalid in such clothing
Only if she prays outside the hospital
She must delay all prayers until she goes home

quizzes.explanation: If unable to change and she has done her best to clean impurities, she may pray. Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to recite surahs out of sequence in prayer?

options.text: Yes, it is permissible though reciting in order is better
No, it completely invalidates the prayer
Only in voluntary prayers
Only if one forgot the next surah

quizzes.explanation: Reciting surahs out of sequence is permissible though following Quranic order is preferable. The prayer remains valid either way.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to have website advertising revenue depend on visitor numbers?

options.text: Yes, if the content is permissible and there's no fraud
No, it's always gambling
Only if visitors click on ads
Only for Islamic websites

quizzes.explanation: It's permissible if website content is halal and there's no deception. Payment based on views or clicks is a legitimate business model.

quizzes.questionText: When is paying a bribe permissible?

options.text: When necessary to obtain one's legitimate rights that are being withheld
Never under any circumstances
Anytime for any purpose
Only in non-Muslim countries

quizzes.explanation: Paying a bribe is permissible when necessary to obtain one's legitimate rights being unjustly withheld. The sin is on the one taking the bribe, not the one forced to pay.

quizzes.questionText: Is it riba if a father gives one child more than another?

options.text: No, it's not riba but it's injustice that should be avoided
Yes, it's exactly like riba
It's permissible with no issues
Only forbidden if done at death

quizzes.explanation: It's not riba but it is injustice (dhulm). Parents should treat children fairly in gifts. The Prophet commanded equality among children in giving.

quizzes.questionText: Is it sunnah to read Al-Mulk and As-Sajdah between Maghrib and Isha?

options.text: No, there's no authentic evidence for this specific practice
Yes, it's an emphasized sunnah
Yes, but only on Fridays
Yes, but only in Ramadan

quizzes.explanation: There's no authentic evidence from the Prophet for reading these surahs specifically between Maghrib and Isha. It's not an established sunnah practice.

quizzes.questionText: Can someone with chronic constipation break their fast to take medication?

options.text: Yes, if a trustworthy doctor says treatment requires breaking the fast
No, they must fast regardless of the condition
Only if in severe pain
Only in the last week of Ramadan

quizzes.explanation: If a trustworthy Muslim doctor determines that proper treatment requires breaking the fast, then one should not fast and should feed the poor for each day.

quizzes.questionText: What if parents make du'a against their children?

options.text: It may be answered, so parents must avoid cursing their children
It has no effect whatsoever
It's always answered immediately
Children are immune to parents' du'a

quizzes.explanation: Parents' du'a may be answered, so they must not make du'a against their children. The Prophet warned that du'a may coincide with a time of acceptance.

quizzes.questionText: Can women ride with non-mahram drivers?

options.text: No, it's not permissible due to khulwah (seclusion)
Yes, completely permissible with no conditions
Only in cities
Only if the journey is short

quizzes.explanation: It's not permissible for a woman to ride alone with a non-mahram driver as this constitutes khulwah (forbidden seclusion). The Prophet forbade a man being alone with a woman.

quizzes.questionText: Can a man adopt a girl his deceased wife had adopted?

options.text: Not as Islamic adoption, but he can be her guardian and sponsor
Yes, full adoption is permissible
No, she must go to an orphanage
Only if she's under 2 years old

quizzes.explanation: Islamic law doesn't recognize adoption that changes lineage. He can be her guardian and sponsor, but she keeps her original name and inheritance rights differ from biological children.

quizzes.questionText: Can a Muslim woman appear without hijab before a non-Muslim woman?

options.text: No, she should maintain hijab before non-Muslim women
Yes, completely permissible
Only if the non-Muslim woman is elderly
Only in Muslim-majority countries

quizzes.explanation: Muslim women should maintain hijab before non-Muslim women due to lack of trust that the description won't be conveyed to non-mahram men.

quizzes.questionText: Can heirs perform Hajj before executing the deceased's will?

options.text: No, the will must be executed first before distributing inheritance
Yes, Hajj takes priority over everything
Only if the will is small
Only if all heirs agree

quizzes.explanation: The will must be executed before inheritance distribution. The deceased's rights take priority. Only after fulfilling the will can heirs use their inheritance for Hajj.

quizzes.questionText: How can a Muslim intend their whole life to be for Allah?

options.text: By seeking Allah's pleasure in all permissible actions and avoiding sin
Only by praying and fasting constantly
By abandoning all worldly activities
It's impossible to achieve

quizzes.explanation: One can make their entire life for Allah by having the right intention in all permissible deeds, avoiding sin, and seeking Allah's pleasure in work, family, and worship.

quizzes.questionText: Can you pray in the car?

options.text: Voluntary prayers yes with gestures, obligatory prayers only if necessary while traveling
Yes, all prayers without any restrictions
No, never permissible
Only while the car is parked

quizzes.explanation: Voluntary prayers can be prayed in a car with gestures while traveling. Obligatory prayers should be prayed outside unless there's valid excuse during travel.

quizzes.questionText: Is there such a thing as a temporary mahram?

options.text: No, mahram status is permanent and cannot be temporary
Yes, any woman can designate a temporary mahram
Yes, but only for Hajj
Yes, but only for one day

quizzes.explanation: There's no such thing as a temporary mahram in Islam. Mahram relationship is permanent through blood, marriage, or breastfeeding and cannot be created temporarily.

quizzes.questionText: Is counterbalancing interest in the bank permissible?

options.text: No, any involvement with riba is forbidden
Yes, if the amounts are equal
Yes, if done for charitable purposes
Yes, but only in non-Muslim countries

quizzes.explanation: Counterbalancing interest is not permissible. All forms of riba are strictly forbidden. One should not deposit money in interest-bearing accounts or try to offset interest.

quizzes.questionText: Can a man marry a woman he committed zina with while she's pregnant?

options.text: Not until after she gives birth and completes postnatal bleeding
Yes, immediately to legitimize the child
Never, they can never marry
Only if the pregnancy is aborted

quizzes.explanation: He cannot marry her while pregnant. Marriage is prohibited until after delivery and completion of postnatal bleeding. Abortion is not permissible. They must repent from zina.

quizzes.questionText: Is converting to Islam only for marriage valid?

options.text: The conversion is valid but the person must learn and practice Islam sincerely
No, it's completely invalid
Yes, and no further learning is needed
Only valid if done in front of a scholar

quizzes.explanation: The conversion is outwardly valid, but the person must genuinely learn and practice Islam. Converting only for marriage without true belief is dangerous for one's afterlife.

quizzes.questionText: Can a woman pray aloud in the presence of her mahrams?

options.text: Yes, it is permissible
No, women must always pray silently
Only if they're elderly mahrams
Only in Taraweeh prayers

quizzes.explanation: Women may pray aloud in the presence of mahrams. The restriction on raising voices is for non-mahram men, not for mahrams like father, brother, or husband.

quizzes.questionText: How should one enter ihram for umrah when traveling by plane from Madinah to Jeddah?

options.text: Enter ihram before reaching the miqat, or at the miqat of Dhul-Hulayfah
Enter ihram after landing in Jeddah
Enter ihram at Jeddah airport
Ihram is not required for this route

quizzes.explanation: One should enter ihram before the plane passes over the miqat. If coming from Madinah, the miqat is Dhul-Hulayfah. One should prepare and enter ihram before passing this point.

quizzes.questionText: From where did the Prophet enter ihram?

options.text: From Dhul-Hulayfah when going for Hajj or Umrah
From Makkah itself
From his house in Madinah
From any location he chose

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet entered ihram from Dhul-Hulayfah (now known as Abyar Ali), which is the miqat for people of Madinah. This is about 450 km from Makkah.

quizzes.questionText: Is there special virtue in reading Quran on Fridays or making du'a before Fajr?

options.text: Friday has virtue but no specific proof for du'a before Fajr being special
Both have specific proven virtues
Neither has any special virtue
Only du'a before Fajr is special, not Friday

quizzes.explanation: Friday has established virtue for reciting Quran especially Surah Al-Kahf. However, there's no authentic specific evidence for du'a before Fajr being better than other times.

quizzes.questionText: Does a taxi driver have to pay zakaah?

options.text: Yes, on the money earned if it reaches nisab and a year passes
No, because he provides a service
No, because the car is a tool of trade
Yes, but only on the car's value

quizzes.explanation: A taxi driver pays zakaah on the money he has saved if it reaches the nisab and a lunar year passes. The car itself is not subject to zakaah as it's a tool of trade.

quizzes.questionText: What is the ruling on vanilla essence in food?

options.text: Permissible if alcohol is added for preservation and not intoxicant purposes
Always forbidden due to alcohol content
Only permissible in baked goods
Only permissible if alcohol evaporates completely

quizzes.explanation: Vanilla extract with alcohol added for preservation (not intoxication) is permissible according to the correct scholarly view. The small amount and purpose make it halal.

quizzes.questionText: Does a man need ghusl if he only sees or talks to a non-mahram woman?

options.text: No, ghusl is only required for specific impurities or sexual activity
Yes, anytime he sees a non-mahram woman
Yes, but only if he talks to her
Yes, but only if she's unveiled

quizzes.explanation: Ghusl is not required merely from seeing or talking to a non-mahram woman. Ghusl is only obligatory after specific acts like intercourse, ejaculation, menstruation, or postnatal bleeding.

quizzes.questionText: Are there authentic Shi'ah hadith about mass death before the Mahdi?

options.text: Focus should be on authentic Sunni sources, not Shi'ah sources
Yes, they're all authentic
Yes, and they're more reliable than Sunni sources
All hadith about the Mahdi are fabricated

quizzes.explanation: Muslims should rely on authentic Sunni hadith collections. Shi'ah sources contain many fabrications and innovations. Signs of the Hour should be studied from authentic Sunni sources.

quizzes.questionText: Are images of blessings in the grave authentic?

options.text: No, they are fabrications with no authentic basis
Yes, they're confirmed by authentic hadith
Yes, many people have witnessed them
They're authentic but shouldn't be publicized

quizzes.explanation: Images and detailed descriptions of blessings in the grave circulating online are fabrications without authentic chain of narration. Muslims should rely only on authentic sources.

quizzes.questionText: Is a promise never to remarry after husband's death binding?

options.text: No, such promises are not binding in Islam
Yes, it must be fulfilled
Only if made in writing
Only if made before witnesses

quizzes.explanation: Such promises are not binding. A woman has the right to remarry after her husband's death. No one can obligate her to remain unmarried forever.

quizzes.questionText: Is saying Bismillah essential before wudu?

options.text: It is sunnah and recommended but not a condition for validity
It is absolutely required or wudu is invalid
It is not needed at all
It is only required for Fajr prayer

quizzes.explanation: Saying Bismillah before wudu is sunnah and recommended but not a condition of validity. If omitted, the wudu is still valid according to majority of scholars.

quizzes.questionText: What does it mean to learn Allah's beautiful names by heart?

options.text: To know them, understand their meanings, and worship Allah through them
Only to memorize them by rote
To recite them 100 times daily
To write them down repeatedly

quizzes.explanation: Learning Allah's names by heart means memorizing them, understanding their meanings, worshipping Allah through them, and implementing their implications in one's life.

quizzes.questionText: What should someone interested in Islam do?

options.text: Learn about its basic beliefs, read the Quran, and consider sincerely taking shahada
Wait several years before deciding
Only learn from one specific scholar
Memorize the entire Quran first

quizzes.explanation: Someone interested should learn about Islamic monotheism, the Prophet Muhammad, and basic beliefs. Reading the Quran and authentic books helps. Taking shahada when convinced is the first step.

quizzes.questionText: Should one do prostration of forgetfulness after making up a missed part of prayer?

options.text: Yes, if the forgetfulness occurred in the original part of the prayer
No, never after making up missed parts
Yes, always regardless of when the mistake occurred
Only if praying alone

quizzes.explanation: If the forgetfulness occurred in the original prayer with the imam, one should do the prostration of forgetfulness after completing the missed portion when praying alone.

quizzes.questionText: Can anyone bring the dead back to life?

options.text: No, only Allah can give life to the dead
Yes, prophets could do it independently
Yes, righteous people can do it
Yes, through specific du'as

quizzes.explanation: Only Allah can bring the dead back to life. Prophets who revived the dead did so only by Allah's permission and power, not by their own power.

quizzes.questionText: Is regarding the number 13 as unlucky permissible?

options.text: No, it is a form of superstition forbidden in Islam
Yes, it's proven to be unlucky
Yes, but only in Western countries
It's neither good nor bad

quizzes.explanation: Regarding any number as inherently unlucky is superstition forbidden in Islam. Good and bad come only from Allah's decree, not from numbers.

quizzes.questionText: What if a ministry doesn't ask for return of mistakenly given grant money?

options.text: He should inform them of the mistake and offer to return it
He can keep it without any concern
He should give it to charity
He should use it for Islamic purposes

quizzes.explanation: He should inform the ministry of the mistake and offer to return the money. Keeping money one isn't entitled to is not permissible even if they don't ask for it back.

quizzes.questionText: What if sent overseas and given complete salary by mistake?

options.text: He must inform his employer of the overpayment and return it
He can keep it as it's their mistake
He should give it to charity anonymously
He can keep it if he needs it

quizzes.explanation: He must inform his employer of the overpayment and return what he's not entitled to. Keeping it would be consuming people's wealth wrongfully.

quizzes.questionText: Is eating sweets with very small amounts of alcohol permissible?

options.text: If the amount is so minute it has no effect, scholars differ but most permit it
Absolutely forbidden regardless of amount
Only permissible if one is unaware
Only permissible outside Muslim countries

quizzes.explanation: If alcohol is present in such minute amounts that it has no intoxicating effect and is chemically transformed, many scholars permit it. However, it's better to avoid doubtful matters.

quizzes.questionText: Is a conditional divorce nullified if the couple divorces completely then remarries?

options.text: Yes, the previous conditional divorce is nullified with new marriage contract
No, it remains in effect forever
Only if both parties agree
Only if pronounced before witnesses

quizzes.explanation: When a complete divorce occurs followed by a new marriage contract, previous conditional divorces are nullified. The new marriage is a fresh contract with no effect from previous conditions.

quizzes.questionText: Is dyeing hair red haram?

options.text: Bright red imitating non-Muslims is disliked; natural henna red is permissible
All red is absolutely forbidden
All red is completely permissible
Only men can dye hair red

quizzes.explanation: Bright unnatural red imitating non-Muslims is disliked or forbidden. Natural red from henna is permissible as the Prophet approved of it for elderly men and women.

quizzes.questionText: Why is it important to know Allah's beautiful names?

options.text: To worship Allah properly, increase faith, and make appropriate du'a
Only to pass religious exams
They have no practical importance
Only scholars need to know them

quizzes.explanation: Knowing Allah's names increases faith, helps worship Him properly, enables making appropriate du'a, and brings one closer to Allah. The Prophet said whoever knows them will enter Paradise.

quizzes.questionText: Where should amputated limbs be buried?

options.text: They should be buried in any appropriate place, in a cemetery if possible
They must never be buried
Only in official cemeteries with full funeral
They should be cremated

quizzes.explanation: Amputated limbs should be buried in a respectful manner, preferably in a cemetery. They're part of the human body and deserve dignified treatment.

quizzes.questionText: Is zakaah due on manufacturing equipment?

options.text: No, only on the products made for sale and business profits
Yes, on the equipment's value annually
Yes, but only when equipment is sold
Yes, but only on rented equipment

quizzes.explanation: Zakaah is not due on equipment and tools used for manufacturing. Zakaah is only due on the goods produced for sale and on business profits that reach nisab.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to elect those who mock religion to city councils?

options.text: No, it is forbidden to give authority to those who mock Islam
Yes, if they're competent
Yes, in non-Muslim countries
Only if no other candidates available

quizzes.explanation: It is not permissible to elect or support those who mock Islam or its teachings. Muslims should not give authority or support to those who oppose Islamic values.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to bury the dead at night?

options.text: Yes, it is permissible if necessary
No, it is completely forbidden
Only for non-Muslims
Only in emergencies

quizzes.explanation: Burying the dead at night is permissible when necessary. The Prophet buried some companions at night. However, delaying for daytime burial is preferable if there's no harm.

quizzes.questionText: Is working in an institute teaching interest-based financial courses permissible?

options.text: No, as it involves promoting and teaching what is haram
Yes, if one doesn't personally deal with interest
Yes, if done in non-Muslim countries
Yes, if salary comes from other sources

quizzes.explanation: It's not permissible to work in institutions that teach interest-based finance as it involves promoting riba. One should seek halal employment and Allah will provide.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to say 'Life is no good'?

options.text: No, it suggests dissatisfaction with Allah's decree and is disliked
Yes, it's just expressing feelings
Yes, but only when seriously tested
It's recommended to express struggles

quizzes.explanation: Such statements suggest discontent with Allah's decree and are disliked. A believer should be patient with trials and trust Allah's wisdom while expressing feelings appropriately.

quizzes.questionText: Which sunnah prayers can be offered at forbidden prayer times?

options.text: Only prayers with a specific reason like tahiyyat al-masjid or eclipse prayer
All sunnah prayers can be prayed anytime
No sunnah prayers at all
Only Fajr and Asr sunnah

quizzes.explanation: At forbidden times, only prayers with specific reasons can be performed, such as greeting the mosque, eclipse prayer, or making up obligatory prayers. General voluntary prayers are not allowed.

quizzes.questionText: What are the signs of the approach of the Hour?

options.text: Many signs mentioned in authentic hadith like widespread immorality and competition in building
No signs were mentioned by the Prophet
Only one sign: the sun rising from the west
All signs have already occurred

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet mentioned many minor signs like widespread immorality, competition in tall buildings, loss of trust, and ignorance spreading. Major signs include the Dajjal, descending of Isa, and sun rising from the west.

quizzes.questionText: Is wearing black in mourning permissible?

options.text: There's no basis in Islam for wearing specific colors for mourning
It is obligatory for widows
It is recommended for all mourners
It is sunnah for 40 days

quizzes.explanation: Islam doesn't specify wearing black or any color for mourning. The mourning requirements are about avoiding adornment and perfume, not about clothing colors.

quizzes.questionText: Should someone shave their head after cutting it if they learned about shaving's reward?

options.text: No, cutting the hair is sufficient and shaving after cutting is not prescribed
Yes, they must shave it immediately
Yes, but only during Hajj
Only if less than half the hair was cut

quizzes.explanation: Once the hair is cut, the ritual is complete. Shaving after cutting is not prescribed. Both cutting and shaving fulfill the requirement, and cutting is sufficient.

quizzes.questionText: Is masturbation allowed during Ramadan fasting?

options.text: No, it is forbidden in Ramadan and breaks the fast, requiring qada and kaffaarah
Yes, but only at night
Yes, it doesn't affect the fast
Only if one is unmarried

quizzes.explanation: Masturbation is forbidden generally and especially while fasting. If done while fasting, it breaks the fast and requires making up that day plus kaffaarah (expiation) according to some scholars.

quizzes.questionText: Can you accept a Bible to make someone accept a Quran?

options.text: Yes, to achieve the greater benefit of them receiving the Quran
No, never accept any non-Islamic scripture
Only if you immediately destroy the Bible
Only from Muslims

quizzes.explanation: It's permissible to accept a Bible in order to achieve the greater benefit of giving them the Quran and calling them to Islam. The benefit of da'wah outweighs the concern.

quizzes.questionText: What if someone didn't pay zakaah due to ignorance and money decreased?

options.text: They must pay zakaah on what they had previously, even if money decreased
No zakaah is due since money decreased
Only pay zakaah on current amount
The obligation is waived due to ignorance

quizzes.explanation: They must pay zakaah for the previous years when they had wealth, even if it has decreased now. Ignorance doesn't eliminate the obligation, though there's no sin if truly unaware.

quizzes.questionText: What is the meaning of 'you might have seen the sun declining' in Surah Al-Kahf?

options.text: The sun appeared to decline away from the cave opening due to its position
The sun literally bent its path for them
The cave rotated to avoid the sun
Time stopped inside the cave

quizzes.explanation: This verse describes how the sun would decline away from the cave opening due to its position, keeping the People of the Cave protected from direct sunlight while allowing light and air in.

quizzes.questionText: What are the virtues of Duha prayer?

options.text: It counts as charity for every joint and brings many blessings
It has no specific virtues mentioned
It is obligatory for all Muslims
Only for elderly people

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet said whoever prays Duha will have charity recorded for each of their 360 joints. It's a means of earning reward, blessings, and Allah's pleasure.

quizzes.questionText: Is marrying your friend's widow after his death a betrayal?

options.text: No, it is permissible and can be a good deed to care for her
Yes, it is always a betrayal
Only permissible if the friend had no children
Only permissible after 10 years

quizzes.explanation: It is not a betrayal but can be a good deed. Some companions married their deceased friends' widows to care for them. It should be done with good intentions and respecting all parties.

quizzes.questionText: What is the difference between Al-Aqsa and the Dome of the Rock?

options.text: Al-Aqsa is the entire mosque compound; Dome of the Rock is one building within it
They are two completely different places
They are exactly the same building
Dome of the Rock is in Jerusalem, Al-Aqsa is in Palestine

quizzes.explanation: Al-Aqsa refers to the entire mosque compound in Jerusalem. The Dome of the Rock is one significant building within the Al-Aqsa compound, not the mosque itself.

quizzes.questionText: Does a person with Down's syndrome have to fast?

options.text: Only if they have the mental capacity to understand and bear fasting
Yes, absolutely required
Never, all mentally disabled are exempt permanently
Only after age 20

quizzes.explanation: If the person has mental capacity to understand religious obligations and can bear fasting, they should fast. If not, they're not obligated. Each case varies based on capability.

quizzes.questionText: Is permission needed to print and sell books of scholars?

options.text: Yes, permission from copyright holders is required
No, Islamic knowledge should always be free
Only for living scholars
Only for books written in the last 50 years

quizzes.explanation: Permission from copyright holders is required to print and sell books. Even though spreading knowledge is good, the rights of authors and publishers must be respected.

quizzes.questionText: Can you marry two sisters simultaneously in Islam?

options.text: No, it is absolutely forbidden to be married to two sisters at the same time
Yes, it is permissible
Only if they both agree
Only if from different mothers

quizzes.explanation: It is absolutely forbidden to be married to two sisters simultaneously. This is explicitly prohibited in the Quran. One may only marry a sister after completely divorcing the other.

quizzes.questionText: Should grandchildren be treated fairly in gift-giving?

options.text: Yes, fairness among grandchildren in gifts is recommended
No, grandparents can favor whomever they wish
Only male grandchildren need equal treatment
Only if they live in the same house

quizzes.explanation: Like with children, fairness and justice in gift-giving to grandchildren is recommended to avoid hurt feelings and maintain family harmony, though not obligatory.

quizzes.questionText: Why are Muslims not united in their fasting?

options.text: Due to differences in moon sighting methodology and geographical locations
Because some Muslims are wrong
Because of political divisions only
They should all follow Saudi Arabia

quizzes.explanation: Differences arise from legitimate scholarly differences about moon sighting methodology - whether to follow local sighting, astronomical calculations, or unified sighting. All views have some basis.

quizzes.questionText: How authentic are hadiths about wudu before sleep?

options.text: Authentic and established in Sahih collections
All are fabricated
Only weakly narrated
No such hadiths exist

quizzes.explanation: The hadiths encouraging wudu before sleep are authentic and found in Sahih collections. The Prophet recommended it as protection and so one dies in a state of purity if death comes.

quizzes.questionText: Does a slave woman become free if her master marries her?

options.text: No, but he should free her; she gains some rights through marriage
Yes, automatically upon marriage
Only if specifically stated in marriage contract
Only after having children

quizzes.explanation: Marriage doesn't automatically free a slave woman, but it is recommended to free her. Marriage does give her additional rights and changes her status somewhat.

quizzes.questionText: Is offering sacrifice in gratitude to Allah permissible?

options.text: Yes, it is permissible and a good deed when done correctly
No, it is innovation
Only obligatory sacrifices are allowed
Only during Eid al-Adha

quizzes.explanation: Offering voluntary sacrifice to thank Allah for blessings is permissible and good. It should be done properly by slaughtering while saying Allah's name and distributing meat.

quizzes.questionText: Is it permissible to put things on top of religious books?

options.text: It is disliked to place things on top of Quran and religious books out of respect
Completely permissible with no concern
Only other books can be placed on top
Forbidden and major sin

quizzes.explanation: Out of respect and veneration, it is disliked to place things on top of the Quran and religious books. They should be kept in an elevated, clean, and respected place.

quizzes.questionText: Can Ramadan makeup fasts be done separately or must they be consecutive?

options.text: They may be done separately on non-consecutive days
They must be done consecutively
They must be done in the month immediately after Ramadan
They must all be done in the same week

quizzes.explanation: Making up missed Ramadan fasts can be done on separate, non-consecutive days. There's no requirement for them to be consecutive unless one is making up for an oath or specific vow.

quizzes.questionText: Can you repent without making wudu or ghusl first?

options.text: Yes, repentance doesn't require wudu or ghusl
No, wudu is required for repentance to be accepted
No, ghusl is required for major sins
Only for minor sins

quizzes.explanation: Repentance doesn't require wudu or ghusl to be valid. However, one should be in a state of purity for prayer if praying two units of repentance, which is recommended but not required.

quizzes.questionText: Is there a du'a before marital relations?

options.text: Yes, the Prophet taught a specific du'a for protection from Satan
No, no du'a is prescribed
Only for the first time
Only during Ramadan

quizzes.explanation: The Prophet taught: 'Bismillah, O Allah keep us away from Satan and keep Satan away from what You bestow upon us.' This protects any resulting children from Satan's harm.

quizzes.questionText: What does the name 'Al-Khaafid' (The Abaser) mean?

options.text: It refers to Allah lowering the status of enemies and evildoers
It is not one of Allah's authentic names
It means Allah makes everyone humble
It only applies to disbelievers

quizzes.explanation: Al-Khaafid means The Abaser - Allah lowers the status of His enemies and those who deserve it. It's paired with Ar-Raafi' (The Exalter). Some scholars question if it's an established Name.

quizzes.questionText: Must a daughter execute her father's will to marry her cousin?

options.text: No, such a will is not binding and she has the right to refuse
Yes, she must obey her father's will absolutely
Only if the cousin is wealthy
Only if she was consulted before his death

quizzes.explanation: Such a will is not binding. A woman cannot be forced to marry anyone. She has the right to refuse. Marriage requires the woman's consent.

quizzes.questionText: How can Iblees be punished with fire when created from it?

options.text: Allah can make fire painful to him despite his origin
He cannot actually be punished with fire
He will be punished with cold instead
Only his descendants will be punished

quizzes.explanation: Allah can make fire a source of pain and punishment for Iblees despite his creation from it. Allah's power is absolute. Punishment is by Allah's will, not by the nature of elements.

quizzes.questionText: Are sounds made by mouth imitating musical instruments permissible?

options.text: No, if they imitate musical instruments they take the same ruling
Yes, completely permissible as no actual instrument is used
Only permissible for children
Only permissible in private

quizzes.explanation: Sounds made by mouth that imitate prohibited musical instruments take the same ruling as the instruments themselves. The prohibition is on the sound and effect, not just the instrument.

quizzes.questionText: Is paying money in advance to landlord for reduced rent permissible?

options.text: Scholars differ; majority say it's permissible as it's not a loan with benefit
Absolutely forbidden as it's riba
Only permissible in non-Muslim countries
Only if the discount is less than 10%

quizzes.explanation: Scholars differ on this. The majority view is that it's permissible because it's prepayment for services, not a loan with interest. However, some scholars are cautious about it resembling riba.

quizzes.questionText: If imam forgets Quran verses, how can he complete the recitation?

options.text: He can recite them in the next rak'ah or subsequent prayers
The prayer is automatically invalid
He must stop the prayer immediately
He must repeat the same surah until remembered

quizzes.explanation: If an imam forgets verses while attempting to complete the Quran in Taraweeh, he can recite them in the next rak'ah or subsequent prayers. Order is preferred but not required for prayer validity.

quizzes.questionText: Is urinating while standing haram?

options.text: It is permissible but sitting is better for cleanliness and modesty
It is absolutely forbidden
It is obligatory to stand
Only permissible when traveling

quizzes.explanation: Urinating while standing is permissible, though sitting is better and was the Prophet's usual practice. Standing is allowed if one can avoid splashing and maintain cleanliness.

quizzes.questionText: Is announcing a death in the mosque permissible?

options.text: Yes, it is permissible to inform people so they can pray and attend the funeral
No, it is completely forbidden
Only for scholars and leaders
Only if the person died in the mosque

quizzes.explanation: It is permissible to announce a death to inform people so they can pray for the deceased and attend the funeral. This is not the forbidden 'announcement of death' mentioned in hadith, which refers to excessive announcements for show.

quizzes.questionText: What is the amount of fidyah for not fasting?

options.text: Feeding one poor person for each missed day with approximately half a sa' of food
Pay any amount of charity
Fast three days for each missed day
Pay 10% of one's wealth

quizzes.explanation: The fidyah is feeding one poor person for each missed day. The amount is half a sa' (approximately 1.5 kg) of the local staple food like rice or wheat, or its monetary equivalent.

quizzes.questionText: Is raising the hands in qunoot prescribed?

options.text: Yes, the Prophet raised his hands during qunoot
No, hands should remain at the sides
Only during Witr
Only in Fajr prayer

quizzes.explanation: Raising the hands during qunoot is prescribed and reported from the Prophet. The hands should be raised for the supplication made in qunoot.
